title: Agile and DevSecOps
description: A comprehensive course exploring agile methodologies, DevSecOps practices, and modern software development lifecycles.

learning_objectives: Understand the core principles of Agile
Compare traditional and Agile development approaches
Explore continuous integration and continuous deployment

faqs.question: What tools will we use in this course?
faqs.answer: We'll use Jira for project management, Git for version control, Jenkins for CI/CD, and various security testing tools like SonarQube and OWASP ZAP.

faqs.question: Is prior DevOps experience required?
faqs.answer: No prior DevOps experience is required. The course is designed to take students from beginner to advanced levels.

faqs.question: What is the main project for this course?
faqs.answer: Students will develop a software project using Agile methodologies, implementing DevSecOps practices throughout the development lifecycle.

faqs.question: How are grades calculated?
faqs.answer: Grades are based on project deliverables (40%), mid-term assessment (10%), final presentation (25%), and class participation (25%).

faqs.question: What are the key learning outcomes?
faqs.answer: Students will learn Agile and Scrum practices, DevOps principles, security integration in software development, and hands-on project management skills.

title: Cloud Computing
description: An in-depth exploration of cloud computing technologies, architectures, and best practices for modern enterprise solutions.
prerequisites: Basic networking and system administration knowledge

learning_objectives: Learn about identity and access management
Understand multi-cloud and hybrid cloud strategies

faqs.question: Which cloud platforms will we learn?
faqs.answer: The course covers AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud Platform, with a focus on practical skills and certifications.

faqs.question: Do I need my own cloud account?
faqs.answer: We'll provide student credits for cloud platforms. Personal accounts are not mandatory but can be helpful for additional practice.

faqs.question: What certifications can this course help me prepare for?
faqs.answer: The course content aligns with AWS Cloud Practitioner and Azure Fundamentals certification exams.

faqs.question: What will be the main project?
faqs.answer: Students will design and implement a cloud-based application with a focus on scalability, security, and performance.

faqs.question: Are there any hardware requirements?
faqs.answer: A modern laptop with at least 8GB RAM is recommended. Cloud-based labs will be used for most practical exercises.

title: AI and Machine Learning
description: A comprehensive introduction to artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies, covering theoretical foundations and practical applications.

learning_objectives: Introduction to Python for machine learning
Clean and prepare data for machine learning
Understand decision trees and random forests
Explore convolutional and recurrent neural networks

syllabus.topic: Natural Language Processing and AI Applications

faqs.question: What programming language will we use?
faqs.answer: Python will be the primary language, using libraries like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.

faqs.question: Do I need advanced mathematics background?
faqs.answer: Basic linear algebra and calculus are helpful. We'll provide mathematical foundations as part of the course.

faqs.question: What kind of project will we do?
faqs.answer: Students will develop a machine learning project solving a real-world problem, from data collection to model deployment.

faqs.question: Are there any hardware requirements?
faqs.answer: A laptop with at least 8GB RAM is recommended. We'll use cloud-based GPU resources for deep learning exercises.

faqs.question: What career paths does this course support?
faqs.answer: This course prepares students for roles in data science, AI engineering, machine learning research, and AI product development.

title: Cybersecurity and Ethical Hacking
description: A comprehensive exploration of cybersecurity principles, defensive strategies, and ethical hacking techniques.

learning_objectives: Explore the CIA triad (Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability)
Learn about VPNs and secure communications
Identify and mitigate web application vulnerabilities

faqs.question: Do I need special equipment for this course?
faqs.answer: A laptop with virtualization capabilities is recommended. We'll use virtual machines for hands-on labs.

faqs.question: Is this course legal?
faqs.answer: All activities are strictly ethical and legal. We follow responsible disclosure principles and only test in controlled environments.

faqs.question: What tools will we learn?
faqs.answer: We'll use tools like Kali Linux, Metasploit, Wireshark, Nmap, and various security assessment frameworks.

faqs.question: What certifications can this course help with?
faqs.answer: The course content aligns with CompTIA Security+ and CEH (Certified Ethical Hacker) certification preparation.

faqs.question: What is the final project?
faqs.answer: Students will conduct a comprehensive security assessment of a simulated enterprise network, documenting findings and remediation strategies.

title: Advanced Data Analytics
description: A deep dive into advanced data analytics techniques, covering statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and big data technologies.

learning_objectives: Use Apache Spark for large-scale data analysis
Use tools like Tableau and D3.js

faqs.question: What programming languages will we use?
faqs.answer: Python and R will be the primary languages, with additional tools like SQL and Spark for big data processing.

faqs.question: Do I need advanced mathematics background?
faqs.answer: Advanced statistics and linear algebra knowledge is beneficial. We'll provide comprehensive mathematical foundations.

faqs.question: What kind of project will we develop?
faqs.answer: Students will work on a comprehensive data analytics project, from data collection to advanced predictive modeling and visualization.

faqs.question: Are there any hardware requirements?
faqs.answer: A laptop with at least 16GB RAM is recommended. We'll use cloud-based computing resources for intensive data processing.

faqs.question: What career paths does this course support?
faqs.answer: This course prepares students for roles in data science, business intelligence, predictive analytics, and advanced research positions.
